properties.Name: PolicyInspectionReport
properties.Description:
A report performed by an Investigator providing facts required for a proper underwriting decision on an application for new insurance or insurance reinstatement.

Policy inspection reports are normally required by Insurance companies on applicants who apply for large amounts of life insurance.    Policy inspection reports detail information to determine the insurability of the individual.    These reports are normally obtained from national investigative agencies or firms.

Inspection Reports addresses criteria such as:

Ex:  
- applicant character
- applicant reputation
- applicant mode-of-living
- applicant finances
- applicant exposure to hazards

Columns.Name: PolicyInspectionReportId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Policy Inspection Report.

Columns.Name: InspectionReportByPartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Columns.Name: PolicyInspectionReportPerformedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Inspection Report was performed.

Columns.Name: PolicyInspectionReportSubmittedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Inspection Report was submitted.

Columns.Name: PolicyInspectionReportEvaluatedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Inspection Report was evaluated by the Insurer.

Columns.Name: PolicyInspectionReportRecommendation
Columns.Description: The recommendation of the Inspection Report.

Columns.Name: PolicyInspectionReportNote
Columns.Description: Comments or additional information regarding the associated Inspection Report.

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.
